titlestmt.titleproper: Reeves, Ben, artifacts and memorabilia collection on University of Kentucky athletics
Guide to the Ben Reeves Artifacts and Memorabilia Collection on University of Kentucky Athletics, 1962-2013, undated 2018ua021
titlestmt.author: Justin Davies, Ruth E. Bryan

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-09 13:43:21 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: Undetermined, Code for undetermined script script.

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: Ben Reeves Artifacts and Memorabilia Collection on University of Kentucky Athletics
did.abstract: The Ben Reeves Artifacts and Memorabilia Collection on University of Kentucky Athletics (1962-2013, undated; 9 cubic feet; 12 boxes and 1 tube) comprises primarily three-dimensional objects, photograph albums, and videocassette tapes documenting the play, publicity, and marketing of the individual athletes, games, and tournaments of the University of Kentucky football and men's basketball teams from the mid-20th century through the early 21st century.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by format into four series: Artifacts and Memorabilia; Correspondence; Scrapbooks/Photograph Albums; and Commercially-produced Videocassette Tapes.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ben Noland Reeves (May 20, 1947-February 12, 2014) was born in Danville to James F. and Amanda Johnson Reeves. Reeves was a teacher in the Garrard County School System, the librarian at Garrard County High School, and an employee of the Central Record newspaper. He was also a member of the Lancaster Baptist Church and the Garrard-Lincoln Camp of Gideons International. Reeves was a University of Kentucky sports enthusiast.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2018ua021 : [identification of item], Ben Reeves Artifacts and Memorabilia Collection on University of Kentucky Athletics, 1962-2013, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: 2001ua043: Special Collections Research Center. University of Kentucky Memorabilia and Ephemera Collection, 1875-2016, undated.
2008ua025: Special Collections Research Center. University of Kentucky Athletic Publications Collection, 1900-2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ben Reeves Artifacts and Memorabilia Collection on University of Kentucky Athletics (1962-2013, undated; 9 cubic feet; 12 boxes and 1 tube) comprises primarily three-dimensional objects, photograph albums, and videocassette tapes documenting the play, publicity, and marketing of the individual athletes, games, and tournaments of the University of Kentucky football and men's basketball teams from the mid-20th century through the early 21st century. The objects include banners; basketballs; bumper stickers; buttons; cups, flyers; game tickets; glasses, and mugs; lighters; plaques; player cards; and scorecards. The scrapbooks and photograph albums contain newspaper clippings and head and action shots for specific men's basketball players, including Thomas Miller Kron (1962-1965), Jimmy Dan Conner (in high school, 1970-1974, and in college, 1974-1975), Mike Phillips (1974-1975), and Jim Master (1983-1984); as well as head, action, and Reeve's own snapshots of basketball teams, games, and tournaments, especially the 1974-1975 team, the 1983 Kentucky-University of Louisville game, and the 1987 Southeastern Conference (SEC) tournament in Atlanta, Georgia. There are also some Kentucky high school boy's basketball teams and games represented. The videocassettes comprise commercially produced documentaries, celebrations, and marketing pieces for UK football and men's basketball, as well as for a few Kentucky high school football and boy's basketball teams and tournaments. There are also photographs of teams, individual players, and snapshots of Rupp Arena (Lexington, Ky.); newspaper clippings; game programs; and correspondence. The publications received with the collection have been interfiled into the Special Collections Research Center's athletic publications collection (2008ua025).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.
